alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 28 at 9:26PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM HST SUNDAY FOR THE ISLAND OF MOLOKAI IN MAUI COUNTY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Molokai in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 920 PM HST, radar indicated moderate to heavy rainfall will continue to move over Molokai from the northeast over the next several hours. Rain rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour can be expected from this rainfall. - This advisory includes the entire island of Molokai. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 1230 AM HST if flooding persists. This Flood Advisory replaces the previously issued Flash Flood Warning that was in effect for The island of Molokai in Maui County.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. A Flood Watch is also in effect for Maui County through 6 PM HST Sunday.
